info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of McCulloch and San Saba Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 100 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brady, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brady, San Saba, Richland Springs, Algerita, Melvin, Brady Lake, Sloan, Lohn, Calf Creek, Skeeterville, Voca, Chappel, Elm Grove, Camp San Saba, Rochelle, Pear Valley, Salt Gap, Placid, Mercury and Hall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
